Hey, ladiaria, You have been responsified!

Instead of keep complaining about the lack of responsiveness of the local newspapers I use to read online, I decided to take the iniciative and responsify ladiaria's website.

I have responsified only articles and sections, both the kind of pages I access more frequently from my mobile. Since I obviously wasn't able to rewrite the page structure (something I would've like to, since they're unfortunately serving HTML 4.01), I was constrained to overwrite the styles only.

If the folks of ladiaria accept my suggestion, they should download responsify.css to the website's media directory and drop the following line in the head tag, after loading all the stylesheets: <link type="text/css" href="responsify.css" rel="stylesheet">

Be warned that responsify.css is intended only for articles and sections, so load it when rendering those pages only.

I hope the folks of ladiaria understand the importance of moving towards a responsive experience and accept this challenge.
